channel.title: Crypto News - SosoValue Research
channel.description: Latest crypto news from SosoValue Research

item.title: Ghana’s Central Bank plans to launch crypto regulatory framework to promote digital assetsOn July 24, the Central Bank of Ghana plans to introduce a licensing system for crypto platforms to regulate digital assets and capture related revenues. Central Bank Governor Johnson Asiama revealed that the regulatory framework is expected to be submitted to parliament for review in September this year. The new bill aims to use cryptocurrencies to promote cross-border trade, attract strategic investments, and collect financial data to advance the country’s digital asset sector. Earlier news, the Governor of the Central Bank of Ghana said: Ghana is finalizing the regulatory framework for cryptocurrency transactions. [PANews]

item.title: Satsuma (formerly Tao Alpha) raises over £100 million to promote AI and Bitcoin deploymentOn July 24, the listed company Satsuma (formerly Tao Alpha) announced that it had completed the fundraising of over £100 million of convertible bonds and started the third round of financing, with the minimum subscription threshold reduced to $100,000.00, which is expected to end on July 28. The funds will be used to expand the business and promote the construction of Bitcoin and decentralized AI infrastructure. CEO Henry Elder has officially joined the board of directors as executive director. [PANews]

item.title: Sky Alliance Ventures claimed $1.30M worth of SKY staking rewards half an hour ago and transferred them to the SKY buyback address.According to on-chain analyst Ember, Sky (formerly MakerDAO) co-founder Rune continues to use SKY's staking rewards to repurchase $SKY. Rune claimed SKY staking rewards half an hour ago: 1.90M USDS + 10.378M SPK (worth $1.30M), then transferred them to his repurchase address, and is currently selling SPK to repurchase SKY. [Odaily]

item.title: The EU approves a €93.00B counter-tariff plan against the USEU member states have voted in favor of a measure to impose retaliatory tariffs on a total of €93.00B worth of U.S. products. The day before, a European Commission spokesperson said on July 23 that the EU plans to merge two lists of retaliatory tariffs on U.S. exports into a single list totaling €93.00B. The list mainly involves high-value industrial products such as aircraft, automobiles, and electrical equipment. The total value of the package of retaliatory lists formed by the two lists amounts to €93.00B. European Commission spokesman Olof Gill said on July 23 that if negotiations (with the U.S.) break down, the countermeasures will take effect on August 7. [Odaily News]

item.title: GoPlus launches a 500 million GPS security fund, divided into a token-based reward pool and a token bounty pool.GoPlus announces the launch of a 500 million GPS Security Fund (currently valued at approximately $10.00M USD). There are two ways for users to participate in the fund distribution: users who stake GPS can receive triple benefits (basic annualized + security incident lottery + GoPlus security ecosystem income repurchase); participate in the "Security Bounty List" to participate in obtaining a 100.00M GPS special bounty pool, for example: submit a malicious address / phishing website, with a maximum prize of 10,000 GPS. [Foresight News]

item.title: Binance: Users with App versions lower than 3.0.x will not be able to use the facial pre-check function starting July 28Binance Chinese announced, "Starting July 28th, users of the Binance App with versions lower than 3.0.x will not be able to use the facial pre-check function. Please upgrade to the latest version in time to ensure normal use." [Foresight News]

item.title: Tesla's U.S. stock fell 6% in pre-market trading, with Musk saying Tesla may face some difficult quarters.On July 24, according to data from Hithink RoyalFlush Information Network, Tesla's U.S. stock fell 6.00% in pre-market trading. Tesla's total revenue for the second quarter decreased by 12.00% year-on-year to $22.50B, and Musk said that Tesla may face several difficult quarters next. [深潮 TechFlow]

item.title: Three Meme tokens listed on JuCoin chain, expanding the JuCoin Preferred Zone lineupOn July 24, 2025, according to official sources, JuCoin's on-chain trading Selection Preferred Zone officially launched three popular Memes: memecoin, PYTHIA, and AOL, which are now fully open for trading. Users can enter through the "Trading" - "On-chain Trading" section on the JuCoin App or homepage. It is reported that memecoin emphasizes the community-driven pure Meme spirit; PYTHIA represents a pioneering experiment in the integration of AI and biotechnology; AOL Coin pays tribute to the America Online cultural heritage. This launch will further enrich the JuCoin on-chain ecosystem and meet users' diversified asset allocation needs. [Odaily]

item.title: NFT platform Pixel Vault may cease operationsAccording to the official announcement, NFT platform Pixel Vault announced that after more than four years of development, the company has begun the process of potentially ceasing operations. The company had attempted to create a profitable and sustainable crypto entertainment business, but was unsuccessful. Currently, Pixel Vault is in discussions with multiple parties regarding the possibility of acquiring the company and its assets in order to continue serving the community. [Wu Blockchain]

item.title: The number of ETH queued for unstaking has increased to 637,500.00.According to the latest information from the validatorqueue website, the number of ETH waiting to be unstaked has increased to 637,450, with net redemptions reaching 316,000. The waiting queue length is 11 days and 2 hours, a record high. [Odaily]

item.title: ZachXBT: Ripple co-founder-linked address transferred 50,000,000 XRP, approximately $140,000,000.00 flowed into exchangesAccording to on-chain detective ZachXBT, starting on July 17, 2025, wallet addresses associated with Ripple co-founder Chris Larsen transferred 50,000,000 XRP (approximately $175,000,000.00) to four addresses, of which approximately $140,000,000.00 flowed into exchanges or related service platforms. Some of the funds also flowed into two new addresses, each receiving 5,000,000 XRP. [Wu Blockchain]

item.title: Bitget Wallet has now added a new encrypted payment channel, supporting mainstream consumer platforms including Hema, Honor of Kings, Sinopec, and JD.com.Bitget Wallet has announced the addition of cryptocurrency payment functionality for a variety of everyday consumption scenarios, covering e-commerce shopping, digital entertainment, game top-ups, global travel, and other areas, allowing users to complete one-stop consumption using crypto assets within the wallet. Currently, the platforms and services supported by this function include Sinopec, Suning.com, JD.com, Hema, Tmall Supermarket, Honor of Kings, Steam, and mobile phone top-ups, among others. [Odaily News]

item.title: Amended class action calls Pump.fun a ‘slot machine cabinet’ in $5.5B caseAn amended lawsuit accuses Pump.fun and key Solana partners of operating an unlicensed digital casino that funneled billions through deceptive memecoin schemes.

item.title: US Congress to Advance Veterans Affairs Blockchain Pilot BillThe U.S. Congress is considering the "Department of Veterans Affairs Distributed Ledger Technology Innovation Act of 2025" (H.R. 3455), which aims to promote the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to study the application of blockchain technology in the claims process to improve transparency, traceability, and reduce the risk of fraud and abuse. The bill passed a hearing by the House Veterans Affairs Subcommittee on June 11 and is awaiting a full House vote. If passed, the VA will submit a feasibility study and pilot recommendation report within one year. [CryptoSlate]
